segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're going to be taking you to the airport.
segments.cn: 今天我们将带你去机场。

segments.en: That's right.
We're going to listen as a man checks in at the airport and deals with his luggage.
segments.cn: 我们将听一个男人在机场办理登机手续并处理他的行李。

segments.en: That's right.
So we're going to be looking at a lot of great stuff that can help you the next time you are at the airport at the check-in counter.
segments.cn: 所以我们将看到很多有用的内容，帮助你下次在机场办理登机手续时。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at one word that we're going to preview today in Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 那么我们先来看一个今天在词汇预览中要预习的单词。

segments.en: We're going to hear this guy say, I'd like to check three pieces.
segments.cn: 我们将听到这个人说，我想托运三件行李。

segments.en: He's going to check three pieces of what?
Pieces of luggage.
So when we talk about luggage, we can say pieces of luggage.
segments.cn: 所以当我们谈论行李时，可以说行李件数。

segments.en: That's right.
Luggage is a non-count noun.
So you can't say one luggage, two luggages, three luggages.
segments.cn: 所以你不能说一件行李，两件行李，三件行李。

segments.en: That's wrong.
Right.
So we use pieces of luggage.
Okay.
So three pieces of luggage.
Very good.
Let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 让我们第一次听我们的对话。

segments.en: We're going to see what happens with this guy at the airport and with his pieces of luggage.
segments.cn: 我们将看看这个人在机场和他的行李发生了什么。

segments.en: Next, please.
Hello, sir.
May I see your passport, please?
Yes.
Here you go.
Will you be checking any bags today?
Yes.
I'd like to check three pieces.
I'm sorry, sir.
Airline policy only allows two pieces of check luggage at 20 kilograms each plus one piece of carry-on luggage.
segments.cn: 航空公司政策只允许托运两件行李，每件20公斤，加上一件随身行李。

segments.en: I will have to charge you extra for the additional suitcase.
segments.cn: 我必须对额外的行李收取额外费用。

segments.en: What?
Why?
I'm taking an intercontinental flight.
I'm flying 16,000 kilometers.
How am I supposed to take only two 20 kilo bags?
segments.cn: 我怎么可能只带两件20公斤的行李？

segments.en: That's absurd.
I'm sorry, sir.
There's nothing I can do.
You cannot board the flight with that large bag either.
segments.cn: 你也不能带那件大行李登机。

segments.en: Carry-on bags must fit in the overhead compartment or under your seat.
segments.cn: 随身行李必须放在头顶行李舱或你的座位下。

segments.en: That bag is clearly too big.
Now I see.
You charge next to nothing for an international ticket.
segments.cn: 你们的国际票价几乎不收费。

segments.en: When it comes to charging for any other small thing, you charge an arm and a leg.
segments.cn: 但在收取其他小费用时，你们却要价不菲。

segments.en: So tell me, miss, how much will I have to pay for all of this?
segments.cn: 那么告诉我，小姐，我需要为这一切支付多少？

segments.en: Let's see.
625 US dollars.
That's more than my round-trip ticket!
All right, well, that's a whole lot of money, isn't it?
segments.cn: 好吧，这真是一大笔钱，不是吗？

segments.en: Well, I think it's a very common situation.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一种非常常见的情况。

segments.en: I'm sure many of our listeners can relate to this situation.
segments.cn: 我相信我们的许多听众都能理解这种情况。

segments.en: Overweight charges are pretty expensive.
Very high.
I know from personal experience, but that's not what we want to talk about now.
segments.cn: 我从个人经验中知道，但这不是我们现在想谈的。

segments.en: We want to talk about some really useful vocabulary in language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们想谈谈一些非常有用的词汇在语言收获中。

segments.en: All right, on language takeaway today, we have five words.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的语言收获中，我们有五个单词。

segments.en: So why don't we start with the first one?
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不从第一个开始呢？

segments.en: So the woman asked, will you be checking any bags today?
segments.cn: 所以那个女人问，你今天会托运行李吗？

segments.en: Will you be checking any bags today?
To check bags.
Right, so the verb to check.
It means to give your bags to the airline, to register them.
segments.cn: 它的意思是把你的行李交给航空公司，进行登记。

segments.en: Okay, so that's what happens with your luggage.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是你的行李的处理方式。

segments.en: You check them, so basically they become responsible for your bags.
segments.cn: 你托运它们，所以基本上它们就成了航空公司负责的行李。

segments.en: Right, it reminds me of checking into a hotel.
segments.cn: 对，这让我想起了办理酒店入住。

segments.en: Right, very similar.
When you go to a hotel, you register at the hotel, you check in.
segments.cn: 当你去酒店时，你在酒店登记，办理入住。

segments.en: In this case, you just check your luggage.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你只是托运你的行李。

segments.en: You don't check in your luggage.
segments.cn: 你不需要办理行李入住。

segments.en: Okay, so check luggage.
So he wanted to check three pieces of luggage, and he also had carry on luggage.
segments.cn: 所以他想托运三件行李，他还有随身行李。

segments.en: Carry on luggage.
Carry on.
So carry on luggage, it's pretty simple.
segments.cn: 所以随身行李，这很简单。

segments.en: That's right, you carry it on yourself.
segments.cn: 没错，你自己携带上飞机。

segments.en: Exactly, you carry it onto the plane.
segments.cn: 正是如此，你把它带上飞机。

segments.en: Now we can talk about carry on luggage, right?
segments.cn: 现在我们可以谈谈随身行李，对吗？

segments.en: Or carry on bag.
Right, or a carry on suitcase.
A very small suitcase that can fit under your seat.
segments.cn: 一个非常小的行李箱，可以放在你的座位下。

segments.en: All right, so carry on luggage.
Now he was traveling on an intercontinental flight.
segments.cn: 现在他正在乘坐国际航班。

segments.en: Intercontinental.
Intercontinental.
We have two words there, inter.
Between.
Between, right?
And continental.
So this sounds like continent.
Okay, so he's traveling maybe from Asia to North America.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他可能是从亚洲飞往北美。

segments.en: Okay, intercontinental.
He's trying to board this intercontinental flight.
segments.cn: 他试图登上这趟国际航班。

segments.en: So to board a flight.
Board a plane.
Board a train.
All right, so basically it means to... To get on.
segments.cn: 好的，基本上这意味着... 上车。

segments.en: To get on.
To get on a vehicle.
Okay, so I can say board the ship.
Board the car.
No.
No?
No.
But board the train.
Board the train.
Board the bus.
All aboard.
That's right, that's why in movies you see that somebody will yell all aboard.
segments.cn: 没错，这就是为什么在电影中你会看到有人喊“所有人上车”。

segments.en: In the train station, right?
Exactly.
All aboard.
Okay, so board a vehicle.
segments.cn: 好的，所以登上交通工具。

segments.en: And our last phrase for today.
Overhead compartment.
Overhead compartment.
Overhead compartment.
All right, let's break this phrase down.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们分解一下这个短语。

segments.en: Overhead.
So that's on top of your head, right?
segments.cn: 所以那是在你头顶上，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, yeah.
Above you.
Yeah, and the compartment is a place where you can put something and store it.
segments.cn: 是的，舱是一个可以放东西和存储的地方。

segments.en: Kind of like a box.
Right, so you have an overhead compartment, that big box where you put your bags and your purse or whatever on an airplane.
segments.cn: 对，所以你有一个顶部行李舱，就是你在飞机上放包和钱包的那个大盒子。

segments.en: Very similar to, for example, an overhead projector.
segments.cn: 非常类似于，例如，一个顶投影仪。

segments.en: Right, so that's the machine that puts an image or a picture on a wall, like sometimes you see them in meetings.
segments.cn: 对，所以那是把图像或图片投射到墙上的机器，有时你会在会议中看到它们。

segments.en: Right, so because the image is over your head and it's big, it's called an overhead projector.
segments.cn: 对，所以因为图像在你头上并且很大，所以叫做顶投影仪。

segments.en: Okay, so some great language.
segments.cn: 好的，所以一些很好的语言。

segments.en: Why don't we hear it again in context by listening to the dialogue for the second time?
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话，看看上下文。

segments.en: Next, please.
Hello, sir.
May I see your passport, please?
Yes, here you go.
Will you be checking any bags today?
Yes, I'd like to check three pieces.
I'm sorry, sir.
Airline policy allows only two pieces of checked luggage at 20 kilograms each, plus one piece of carry-on luggage.
segments.cn: 航空公司政策只允许托运两件行李，每件20公斤，外加一件随身行李。

segments.en: I will have to charge you extra for the additional suitcase.
segments.cn: 我必须对额外的行李收费。

segments.en: What?
Why?
I'm taking an intercontinental flight.
I'm flying 16,000 kilometers.
How am I supposed to take only two 20 kilo bags?
segments.cn: 我怎么可能只带两件20公斤的行李？

segments.en: That's absurd.
I'm sorry, sir.
There's nothing I can do.
You cannot board the flight with that large bag either.
segments.cn: 你也不能带那个大包上飞机。

segments.en: Carry-on bags must fit in the overhead compartment or under your seat.
segments.cn: 随身行李必须放在顶部行李舱或你座位下。

segments.en: That bag is clearly too big.
Now I see.
You charge next to nothing for an international ticket.
segments.cn: 你们对国际机票几乎不收费。

segments.en: But when it comes to charging for any other small thing, you charge an arm and a leg.
segments.cn: 但在收费其他小东西时，你们却要价不菲。

segments.en: So tell me, miss, how much will I have to pay for all this?
segments.cn: 所以告诉我，小姐，我需要为这一切支付多少？

segments.en: Let's see.
625 US dollars.
That's more than my round-trip ticket.
All right.
So I think it's a little bit more clear now.
segments.cn: 所以我想现在更清楚了。

segments.en: And with this, it's time for us to take a look at some great phrases in putting it together.
segments.cn: 现在是时候看看一些很好的短语来整合它了。

segments.en: Putting it together.
So this guy was pretty angry about this airline policy, and he said, how am I supposed to?
segments.cn: 所以这个人对航空公司政策非常生气，他说，我该怎么做？

segments.en: How am I supposed to?
How am I supposed to?
Okay.
So before we get into explaining this, why don't we listen to a couple of examples so we can try and understand what it means?
segments.cn: 在我们解释之前，为什么不听几个例子，以便我们尝试理解它的意思？

segments.en: Example one.
How am I supposed to fit the dog in the car?
segments.cn: 我该怎么把狗放进车里？

segments.en: There are 10 people in there already.
Example two.
How is she supposed to get to work if her car's in the shop?
segments.cn: 如果她的车在修理店，她该怎么去上班？

segments.en: Example three.
How are we supposed to know the answer to that?
It's impossible.
Okay, so I can understand that it means how can I do this?
segments.cn: 好的，所以我可以理解这意味着我该怎么做？

segments.en: How do you expect me to do this?
segments.cn: 你怎么期望我做到这一点？

segments.en: How is it possible for me to do this?
segments.cn: 我怎么可能做到这一点？

segments.en: Very good.
It's a phrase you use when you're frustrated, right?
segments.cn: 这是你在感到沮丧时使用的短语，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
You're maybe a little bit frustrated, or you're maybe nervous of something that you can't do or don't know how.
segments.cn: 你可能有点沮丧，或者你可能对某些你无法做到或不知道怎么做的事情感到紧张。

segments.en: Yeah, this phrase, it's not impolite, but it sort of gives the idea that you're challenging the other person a little bit.
segments.cn: 是的，这个短语并不失礼，但它有点挑战对方的意思。

segments.en: Maybe, yeah.
Okay, so a good phrase that you can use in different situations, and you can try and mix it up with different verbs, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一个你可以在不同情况下使用的好短语，你可以尝试用不同的动词来混合使用，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
All right, now let's take a look at our next phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看下一个短语。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir, there's nothing I can do.
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，我无能为力。

segments.en: There's nothing I can do.
There's nothing I can do.
There's nothing I can do.
So basically the woman can't help the man, even though he's insisting and he's pushing that he wants another solution, right?
segments.cn: 所以基本上这个女人无法帮助这个男人，即使他坚持要另一个解决方案，对吧？

segments.en: So finally she says, I'm sorry, there's nothing I can do.
segments.cn: 所以最后她说，对不起，我无能为力。

segments.en: So we use this phrase when someone's pushing you too much, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们在某人过于强求时使用这个短语，对吧？

segments.en: Right, and you would use it only in that situation towards the end, because it is a little bit... It's strong.
segments.cn: 对，只有在那种情况下你才会在最后使用，因为这有点... 这很强烈。

segments.en: It's not impolite, but it's just, you're saying, you know what, I'm sorry, I can't do anything about it.
segments.cn: 这并不失礼，但你是在说，抱歉，我无能为力。

segments.en: Now let's move on to our third phrase.
segments.cn: 现在让我们继续我们的第三个短语。

segments.en: You charge next to nothing.
Next to nothing.
Next to nothing.
Next to nothing.
All right, so we're talking about charging, we're talking about money.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在谈论收费，我们在谈论钱。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to some examples of what this next to nothing phrase means.
segments.cn: 为什么我们不听一些这个“几乎为零”短语的例子呢。

segments.en: Example one.
Do you like my new house?
It was so cheap that it almost cost next to nothing.
segments.cn: 它便宜得几乎没有成本。

segments.en: Example two.
Let's go to Thailand.
Tickets cost next to nothing right now.
Example three.
The real estate agent charged me next to nothing for his commission, so I got a really good deal.
segments.cn: 房地产经纪人收取我几乎为零的佣金，所以我得到了一个很好的交易。

segments.en: So when something costs next to nothing, it's really cheap, right?
segments.cn: 所以当某物几乎为零时，它真的很便宜，对吗？

segments.en: It's really cheap, or you consider it to be cheap.
segments.cn: 它真的很便宜，或者你认为它便宜。

segments.en: And now for our last phrase, it's the complete opposite of next to nothing.
segments.cn: 现在我们的最后一个短语，正好与“几乎为零”相反。

segments.en: Right, charge an arm and a leg.
An arm and a leg.
An arm and a leg.
All right, so this means it's really expensive.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着它真的很贵。

segments.en: It's so expensive, it's like giving your arm and your leg.
segments.cn: 它贵得就像给你自己的手臂和腿。

segments.en: Right, to pay for it.
Very good, so next to nothing, really cheap.
segments.cn: 非常好，所以“几乎为零”，真的很便宜。

segments.en: An arm and a leg, really expensive.
Can we look at the use here?
segments.cn: 我们可以看看这里的用法吗？

segments.en: All right, so in the dialogue we heard, you charge an arm and a leg, but we can also say it costs an arm and a leg.
segments.cn: 好吧，在我们听到的对话中，你收费昂贵得离谱，但我们也可以说它的成本昂贵得离谱。

segments.en: Right, because we are referring to money, right?
segments.cn: 对，因为我们是在谈论钱，对吗？

segments.en: All right, so some great phrases here.
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有一些很好的短语。

segments.en: Now I think it's time we listen to our dialogue one more time.
segments.cn: 现在我觉得是时候再听一次我们的对话了。

segments.en: Next, please.
Hello, sir, may I see your passport, please?
segments.cn: 你好，先生，我可以看一下你的护照吗？

segments.en: Yes, here you go.
Will you be checking any bags today?
Yes, I'd like to check three pieces.
segments.cn: 是的，我想检查三件行李。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir, airline policy only allows two pieces of check luggage at 20 kilograms each plus one piece of carry-on luggage.
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，航空公司政策只允许每人检查两件行李，每件20公斤，加上一件随身行李。

segments.en: I will have to charge you extra for the additional suitcase.
segments.cn: 我必须对额外的行李收费。

segments.en: What?
Why?
I'm taking an intercontinental flight.
I'm flying 16,000 kilometers.
How am I supposed to take only two 20 kilo bags?
segments.cn: 我怎么可能只带两件20公斤的行李？

segments.en: That's absurd.
I'm sorry, sir, there's nothing I can do.
segments.cn: 对不起，先生，我无能为力。

segments.en: You cannot board the flight with that large bag either.
segments.cn: 你也不能带那件大行李登机。

segments.en: Carry-on bags must fit in the overhead compartment or under your seat.
segments.cn: 随身行李必须放在头顶行李舱或你的座位下。

segments.en: That bag is clearly too big.
Now I see.
You charge next to nothing for an international ticket.
segments.cn: 你对国际机票几乎不收费。

segments.en: When it comes to charging for any other small thing, you charge an arm and a leg.
segments.cn: 但在收费其他小东西时，你却收费昂贵得离谱。

segments.en: So tell me, miss, how much will I have to pay for all of this?
segments.cn: 所以告诉我，小姐，我需要为这一切支付多少？

segments.en: Let's see... 625 US dollars.
That's more than my round trip ticket!
Okay, so airline policies, luggage, it's always a problem, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以航空公司政策、行李，总是个问题，对吗？

segments.en: Most of the time you always end up paying overweight when you travel.
segments.cn: 大多数时候你旅行时总是要支付超重费。

segments.en: Yeah, I know that this happened to me once and it was really expensive.
segments.cn: 是的，我知道这曾经发生在我身上，真的很贵。

segments.en: Really?
What happened?
I was flying on an intercontinental flight from India back to Europe.
segments.cn: 我从印度飞回欧洲的国际航班。

segments.en: And I had too many extra bags, but I really needed to bring them.
segments.cn: 我有太多额外的行李，但我真的需要带它们。

segments.en: And so it cost me 6,000 dollars!
6,000 dollars!
Wow!
So my credit card was pretty maxed out after that.
segments.cn: 所以我的信用卡在那之后几乎用满了。

segments.en: That's incredible.
Yeah.
Well, I'm sure many of our users probably suffered similar experiences like this.
segments.cn: 好吧，我相信我们的许多用户可能经历过类似的事情。

segments.en: So please come to our website and share it with us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以请访问我们的网站，与我们分享你的经历，网址是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: That's right, Marco and I are always around to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 没错，马尔科和我总是在这里回答你的问题。

segments.en: So please check us out.
And thanks for downloading, you guys.
Until next time.
Goodbye!
